revised_title: Investigation of Photoelectron Velocity Distribution from Soft X-Rays
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the velocity distribution of photoelectrons produced by soft X-rays. They found that most of the total emission from metals consists of electrons with energies of a few volts only. The authors also developed a new method to measure the current flowing to the collector for different magnetic field values, which helped them determine the number of electrons with specific velocities.
